result.execSummary:
The defendant Quay D Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Ct.2

Imposed and Stayed. Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: Ct. 2

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation.

No contact with the victims (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with the co-defendant- Navaris Howard.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: Defendant granted credit for time served.

Defendant Quay D Howard in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.
DAY THREE:
Jury Instructions read to jurors.
Closing arguments.
Alternate juror chosen and excused.
Oath #3 given.
Jurors to deliberate 9:40 am.
At 1:46 pm, jury foreman indicates that they are deadlocked.
Court reads instruction 520 to jurors.
Jurors back to deliberate 1:50.
At 2:56 pm, jury foreman indicates that they are still deadlocked with no hope of reaching a verdict.
BTC:  Court declares a mistrial.  Finding of manifest injustice is made.
Defense req that jurors be polled.
State does not object.
Jurors polled and excused.
State req that new date be set.
BTC:  Bond is continued.
Defense moves for directed verdict.
State objects.
BTC:  Motion denied.
Defense req bond mod to remove GPS.
State has no objection.
BTC:  Bond mod to remove GPS.


  Jury trial scheduled for November 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Cts 1 & 2: 943.32(@)-Armed Robbery - Threat of Force. Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.   No contact with the victims, GGG and PMH (person, property, residence or family).   No contact with the co-defendant, NH.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 09-25-2015; DEFENDANT MAY SET UP INTERVIEWS VIA THE INTERNET AND ATTEND INTERVIEWS THAT ARE GRANTED. DEFENDANT MAY ENGAGE IN ANY SUBSEQUENT ANY EMPLOYMENT. DEFENDANT MAY PARTICIPATE IN SCHOOL. ALL DATES, TIMES AND LOCATIONS MUST BE VERIFIED WITH ZCI.

**AMENDED 8-18-2016:  GPS MONITORING IS REMOVED AS A CONDITION.  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN.**

Defendant Quay D Howard in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Defense asks that bond be modified again allowing defendant to attend employment interviews and if employed, go to work. Defense has also also indicated that deft has given him information on GED classes. Defense asks that deft be allowed to go to Church. The State does not object to employment but does object to the others

BTC: Modify bond - may set up interviews via the internet and attend those. If deft obtains employment, deft may engage in employment. Deft may participate at school. Deft may not attend church. All dates and times to be verified with ZCI
